name: Cordelia
message: Mr. Marsh！
Where did you go? I've been looking for you the whole time.

name: Marsh
message: Even a half-dead old geezer like me's got things he's gotta do.

name: Cordelia
message: I searched the whole village for you.
I　was　worried　you　might've　lost　it　or　something.

name: Marsh
message: You say things that make this old man happy.
A young lady worrying about me, huh.

name: Marsh
message: Would've been even better if it weren't for that annoying lump behind you.
I don't want you coming and going here too often.
There's absolutely nothing left in the ship's hold.
Wine bottles and other traces of life are scattered all over the room, but that's nothing new, and it doesn't really help figure out when the owner of the room disappeared.

name: Cordelia
message: There's no one here.
Where could Mr. Marsh have gone?

name: Gardner
message: Maybe he went to the ruins again.
For me, that's the only place I can think of that old man might go.

name: Jonathan
message: He could've gone to the Gilman House.
Maybe he ran out of booze.

name: Cordelia
message: If that's the case, I feel kinda bad for Mr. Marsh.
Because of the unreliable boards of the ship's belly, the room feels strangely heavy and oppressive. I can't believe Marsh can live in a place like this.

There’s nothing in the room to prove that this is inside a ship. The walls to the left and right are rounded at the top and bottom because this is the hold, and just a single plank away on the other side is the water.
I can’t believe Marsh is able to sleep in a place like this.
From the way the ship looks, it wouldn’t be strange at all if it started flooding at any moment. There doesn’t seem to be a bathroom or a toilet either, so I wonder where Marsh does his business.
Even seeing us, he doesn’t look the least bit flustered.
Actually, if anything, he even gives off a vibe like he’s satisfied after accomplishing something.
Compared to when I saw him before, he looks a bit healthier now.
I can’t tell if his worries have been taken away, or if the alcohol is suppressing his anxiety, but it’s still better than having him faint right in front of us.
When something gets this dirty, no matter how hard you wash it, there’s no way to bring it back. If I were the master of this room, I’d just chuck it straight out the window.
It looks like the sheet hasn’t been changed for years.
The white linen is stained black with grime, and covered in all sorts of food stains and such.
Even prisoners held in jail probably live a bit cleaner than this. It's a sight that would make anyone, not just Thomas, want to look away.
It's not Thomas, but if I hang around a place like this too long, I'll probably catch some nasty disease.
Doesn't look like it's been cleaned properly at all. The floor is cluttered with all sorts of suspicious rags and empty bottles of cheap liquor scattered everywhere.
From this room, you can practically feel just how messed up the resident's heart is. I don't know what caused it, but Marsh probably doesn't care about being alive anymore.

name: Marsh
message: This is really all I can do.
I do think it's my duty to see through to the end what kind of results your investigation will bring about, but......

name: Marsh
message: I wonder if I'll even be alive by then...

name: Marsh
message: Why are you folks so hung up on something like this?
It's got nothing to do with you at all.

name: Jonathan
message: It's not that it has nothing to do with me.

name: Marsh
message: What do you mean？

name: Jonathan
message: There's a woman from Arkham in my family line.
For　some　reason,　my　family　shunned　her,　and　even　saying　her　name　was　treated　like　a　taboo.

name: Marsh
message: What did you say？
Well then........

name: Jonathan
message: When you looked at my face and said I looked like someone from the Dunwich family, I thought the same thing as you.

name: Jonathan
message: I started thinking maybe I'm the one who inherited the blood of the Dunwich family.

name: Marsh
message: There's no way that's true......

name: Marsh
message: Dollie should have taken care of everything！
If something like that were to happen.........

name: Marsh
message: What the hell did that guy do?
I’ve never believed in things like gods up until now.

name: Marsh
message: But, if that's the case......
I'll probably resent God.

name: Jonathan
message: That's why I want to look into it.
Whether I'm really related by blood to Dunwich.

name: Marsh
message: Got it.....

name: Marsh
message: Do whatever you want.
Take this with you.

name: Jonathan
message: What's this？

name: Marsh
message: This is the key to the room at the Dunwitch Mansion that I took custody of.
There are four, but that's not all of them.

name: Jonathan
message: 他にもまだあるんですか？

name: Marsh
message: わしが持っているのはこれだけじゃ。
I threw away the key to the other room, Dollie's study.

name: Jonathan
message: Why is that?

name: Marsh
message: Because it’s Dollie’s last will.
After my corpse gets carried out, seal up the room as soon as you can, and throw away the key.

name: Jonathan
message: Don't you have a spare key?

name: Marsh
message: いくつかあっただろうが、ドルリイが始末してしまった　　　　　　　ようだ。

name: Marsh
message: I don't know if it was thrown away or hidden.
しかし、何処かにあるのではないかという気はする。

name: Marsh
message: What are you here for.
Do you still need something from me？

name: Jonathan
message: Just like you told me, I’ve been looking into the 『Dunwich Incident’.

name: Marsh
message: So？
You've already checked everything, right? Is there still something missing?

name: Jonathan
message: I got interested in a guy named Dollie Dunwich.
それと、彼の家系にもね。

name: Marsh
message: If you get interested in stuff like that, nothing good's gonna come of it.
Just look at me now！

name: Jonathan
message: The old man who guards the graves was saying this.
You and Dollie were best friends.

name: Jonathan
message: So, you were really fixated on the 'Dunwich Incident,' huh.

name: Jonathan
message: I couldn't stand people saying my best friend Dollie was a lunatic.

name: Marsh
message: Dollie really wasn't crazy at all.
That guy found out.

name: Jonathan
message: What is it？
What kind of truth is so important that you have to kill even your own wife and kids?

name: Marsh
message: Like I care.
It　was　over　60　years　ago.　What's　the　point　in　digging　it　up　now,　huh.

name: Jonathan
message: In fact, you're still hung up on the 'Dunwich Incident', aren't you?

name: Marsh
message: That's not it......
It's not over yet.
Go outside
